sentence.Network_en: Their handshake appeared to be a gesture of reconciliation.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们的握手似乎是和解的表示。

sentence.Network_en: The quick handshake was firm and cool.
John smiled and gave him a hearty handshake.
sentence.Network_cn: 约翰微笑着和他热情地握手。

entry.def: If you give someone a handshake, you take their right hand with your own right hand and hold it firmly or move it up and down, as a sign of greeting or to show that you have agreed about something such as a business deal.

example.ex: John smiled and gave him a hearty handshake...
example.tran: 约翰微笑着和他热情地握手。

means.word_mean: 1. grasping and shaking a person's hand (as to acknowledge an introduction or to agree on a contract)

sentences.en: We sealed our agreement with a handshake.
sentences.cn: 我们最后以握手表示达成了协议。

sentences.en: Fawcett gave me a hearty handshake.
sentences.cn: 福西特和我亲切地握了握手。

sentences.en: The directors will each get a large golden handshake and a pension.
sentences.cn: 所有的经理都会得到丰厚的退职金和养老费。
